pr_title: HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints

timeline.message: HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints

timeline.bodyText: Let's have a followup jira to have overall one db call to fetch all constraints instead of having one for each type of constraint.
timeline.author: adesh-rao

timeline.bodyText:
Also add tests for

all non-empty constraints
few constraints are present
more than 1 constraints are present of a single type on one table.
having multiple tables and then fetching the constraints
timeline.author: adesh-rao

timeline.message: HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Annotation and api signature can be in separate lines.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Follow uniform naming style for arguments.
timeline.author: sankarh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1485,6 +1485,16 @@ void getFileMetadataByExpr(List<Long> fileIds, FileMetadataExprType type, byte[]
   List<SQLCheckConstraint> getCheckConstraints(String catName, String db_name,
                                                    String tbl_name) throws MetaException;
 
+  /**
+   *  Get all constraints of the table
+   * @param catName catalog name
+   * @param db_name database name
+   * @param tbl_name table name
+   * @return all constraints for this table
+   * @throws MetaException error accessing the RDBMS
+   */
+  SQLAllTableConstraints getAllTableConstraints(String catName, String db_name, String tbl_name)

timeline.bodyText: I think, it is redundant as HMS also logs the time taken by get_all_table_constraints api.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: HMS api handles this default catalog name flow. Shall remove it here.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: This can be kept under isDebugEnabled flag.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Will these tests run in our PR build pipeline?
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Use this api in query planner instead of multiple calls.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Add a negative scenario where db invalid or table invalid etc and check if we get NoSuchObjectException.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: We will not get NoSuchObjectException because in the code follow NoSuchObjectException is replaced by MetaException
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: Too much of duplicate code. Can write common methods for the asserts and use it in all tests.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.message: HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints
HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints

timeline.bodyText: nit: Add space after comma between arguments.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Can add utility method to check for null and empty of given list. Used multiple times. Also use local variables to reduce the code.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: Yes, code is very redundant. I have replaced it with CollectionsUtils.isNotEmpty() which does the same check i.e not null and isEmpty()
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: nit: Use "fetchReliable" and "fetchEnabled" instead of "reliable" and "enable" as it sound like flag to enable something.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Other constraints also needs to be filtered based on "enable" flag, right?
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: Yes, Ideally we can fetch all constraint on rely,enable and validate. But in table.java we have chooses to pk,fk,unique and notnull as fetch based on rely. Default and check constraints are fetch based on enable. this method is tightly couple with Hive.java class that's why i have put everything is one method as tableConstraints is single object. But yes we can have separate function for both of them
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: getReliableAndEnableTableConstraints() method name is confusing. It is used in only one place and hence, just expose getTableConstraints() itself.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: nit: Add space before and after "=".
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Log dbName.tblName.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Do we need an extra flag? Can't we just check null for tableConstraintsInfo?
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: Since we have wrapper in place. Now we don't require extra flag to track the object is fetched or not. We can have if condition to check wrapper is null or not
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: Just add a note that we don't make copy of constraints we just refer to same input constraints object.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: Since the legacy way is to just copy the reference. Shouldn't I create a deep copy instead of reference?
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

replies.bodyText: Need to understand from the caller on the usage and add appropriate comment to mark this behavior. Deep-copy would add additional overhead.
replies.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: It is only called when copy/snapshot of the table is taken in semantic analyser.
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: Shall make all members private as we have get and set methods.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Why is it static method? In both the callers, we pass tbl.getTableConstraintsInfo(). This can be a public method without arguments inside "Table" class.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: i was trying to maintain the code uniformity. But since we have a wrapper class in places we can remove all static method and follow OOD para-dime
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: nit: Add space after comma.
timeline.author: sankarh

timeline.bodyText: Method won't return NoSuchObjectException. Shall remove it here and from all implementations.
timeline.author: sankarh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3631,6 +3631,17 @@ boolean cacheFileMetadata(String dbName, String tableName, String partName,
   List<SQLCheckConstraint> getCheckConstraints(CheckConstraintsRequest request) throws MetaException,
       NoSuchObjectException, TException;
 
+  /**
+   * Get all constraints of given table
+   * @param request Request info
+   * @return all constraints of this table
+   * @throws MetaException
+   * @throws NoSuchObjectException
+   * @throws TException
+   */
+  SQLAllTableConstraints getAllTableConstraints(AllTableConstraintsRequest request)

replies.bodyText: I can still see it here.
replies.author: sankarh

timeline.message: HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints
HIVE-22782: Consolidate metastore call to fetch constraints

timeline.bodyText: Will NoSuchObjectException comes here? From the interface, it sounds not. Remove the handling here too.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: I have added NoSuchObjectException in getAllTableConstraints() So we need to handle this here.
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: Shall remove this flag as we can check tableConstraintsInfo != null instead. Btw, we need this flag if we use default constructor in exception flow of getTableConstraintsInfo() method.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: Currently we don't any implementation where we are calling the default constructor. But in order to have a parameterised constructor we need need a default constructor also. As a result of which in future it might possible that some implementation use. the default constructor. So its better to move back to flag based verification.
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText:
Callers are assuming tableConstraintsInfo won't be null after invoking this method but it is not if there is an exception.
Can initialize it with default constructor in this flow.
timeline.author: sankarh

replies.bodyText: If exception generated then fall back to default constructor. As all the constraint will set to null which was the previous contract.
replies.author: ashish-kumar-sharma

timeline.bodyText: This method also throws MetaException.
timeline.author: sankarh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -9330,6 +9330,31 @@ public CheckConstraintsResponse get_check_constraints(CheckConstraintsRequest re
       return new CheckConstraintsResponse(ret);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Api to fetch all table constraints at once
+     * @param request it consist of catalog name, database name and table name to identify the table in metastore
+     * @return all constraints attached to given table
+     * @throws TException
+     */
+    @Override
+    public AllTableConstraintsResponse get_all_table_constraints(AllTableConstraintsRequest request) throws TException {
